data.title: Insights
data.meta_description: Analysis of the Latin American tech ecosystem.
data.text:
Week 29, 2024 - Latin America

As the digital revolution continues to reshape global economies, the gig economy has emerged as a powerful force, particularly in Latin America. Characterized by short-term contracts and freelance work, the gig economy offers flexibility and new income opportunities for millions of workers. Often referred to as a "white-collar...

Proptech Market Potential in Latin America

Despite traditional sectors still dominating, proptech in Latin America is witnessing a growth trajectory. The region's burgeoning middle class, coupled with urbanization trends and technological advancement, are fostering a favourable environment for proptech expansion. Proptech solutions are having a profound socioeconomic impact...

Foreign Direct Investment Trends in Latin America

The World Investment Report 2024 highlights that Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) to Latin America and the Caribbean slightly declined by 1% to $193 billion in 2023, maintaining relative stability amid global economic fluctuations. FDI refers to an investment made by an entity or investor from one country into a business or project...

White Gold Rush - Lithium in Latin America

In the race to transition towards a greener, more sustainable future, lithium has emerged as a cornerstone element. Often referred to as "white gold," lithium is integral to the batteries that power our smartphones, laptops, electric vehicles (EVs), and renewable energy storage systems. Its unique properties make it a key player in...

Agtech Challenges in Latin America

Agricultural technology (agtech) in Latin America faces several challenges and risks that hinder its widespread adoption and effectiveness. Key issues include limited access to financing and investment for small and medium-sized farmers, who make up a significant portion of the agricultural sector. There is a digital divide...

Week 27, 2024 - Latin America

The World Investment Report 2024 highlights that Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) to Latin America. The region saw increased value in greenfield investments in critical minerals and renewable energy sectors, signaling a shift towards sustainable and resource-centric economic activities, despite global economic challenges. Five key...

Foodtech Innovations in Latin America

Foodtech innovation in Latin America is experiencing a remarkable surge, driven by a blend of technological advancements, sustainability efforts, and the region's rich culinary heritage. This dynamic growth is seen in startups and established companies alike, which are harnessing cutting-edge technology and eco-friendly practices...
